meanings.definition: The design, construction, and launching of rockets.
meanings.sent1: Learning about rocketry is exciting for students in science class.
meanings.sent2: Rocketry has advanced significantly over the years.
meanings.sent3: The school's rocketry club is always reaching for the stars.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for rocketry soared higher than any rocket ever could.
meanings.sent5: The museum exhibit on rocketry was filled with fascinating information.

meanings.definition: The science or study of rockets.
meanings.sent1: Rocketry involves understanding the principles of physics.
meanings.sent2: Many universities offer courses in rocketry.
meanings.sent3: The professor's love for rocketry was truly out of this world.
meanings.sent4: In the world of rocketry, knowledge is the ultimate fuel.
meanings.sent5: His dedication to rocketry was evident in every experiment he conducted.

meanings.definition: The activity of launching or operating rockets.
meanings.sent1: The team celebrated the successful rocketry launch.
meanings.sent2: Rocketry requires precise timing and coordination.
meanings.sent3: The rocketry event drew a large crowd of spectators.
meanings.sent4: The thrill of rocketry echoed through the launch site.
meanings.sent5: Participants in the rocketry competition displayed impressive skills.
